conclusion: Identify the sources of liquid as A, B, C, and D at the top of the image.
Observe the arrangement of baffles and containers E, F, and G at the bottom.
The question asks to predict which container (E, F or G) the liquid will flow into.
Assume the question is implicitly asking about the destination of the liquid from source D.
Trace the path of liquid flowing from source D. The liquid flows vertically downwards from D.
The liquid from D first encounters the grey baffle.
The grey baffle is angled downwards and to the right, causing the liquid to be deflected to the right.
The liquid flows along the grey baffle to its right end and then falls downwards.
The falling liquid then encounters the black baffle.
The black baffle is also angled downwards and to the right, causing the liquid to be deflected further to the right.
The liquid flows along the black baffle to its right end and falls downwards.
The container located directly below the right end of the black baffle is container G. Therefore, the liquid from source D flows into container G.
Assuming the question is asking about the destination of liquid from source D, based on the flow through the baffles as depicted in the images, the liquid from D flows into container G.
